subject: Re: Debugging JUnit with emacs
msgSnippet: Steve, I am using Emacs to debug my tests. The key is that you can t use the SwingRunner.  Just use the normal non-GUI runner and you can debug your TestCase
messageBody:
Steve,

I am using Emacs to debug my tests. The key is that you can't use the
SwingRunner. Just use the normal non-GUI runner and you can debug your
TestCase inside of emacs. Since the GUI-runner is nice to have, I
normally have the following main() in my TestCases:

public static void main( String[] args ) {
if (args.length() > 0 ) {
// run without GUI
junit.textui.TestRunner.main( runArgs );
}
else {
junit.swingui.TestRunner.main( runArgs );
}
}

and turn on the read app args setting in JDE. Everytime, I launch a
TestCase, JDE asks me for arguments. If I want to run the debugger I
enter something and the textui.TestRunner is used.

Hope this helps,

Joerg
